All patients should have their tobacco consumption assessed and monitored.

* Simple screening: "Do you smoke?" followed by a decision algorithm until you stop.
* Smoking assessment: ''Packs-Year (PA) = number of packs/day x number of years of intoxication''.

question.title: Smoking assessment: What is the correct formula to calculate the number of packs-year (PA) of tobacco consumption?
question.description: The correct answer should be a mathematical formula involving the number of packs smoked per day and the number of years of tobacco use.

option_a.title: Option A
option_a.description: Packs-Year (PY) = number of packs smoked per day x number of years of intoxication

option_b.title: Option B
option_b.description: Packs-Year (PA) = number of years of tobacco use x number of packs smoked per day

option_c.title: Option C
option_c.description: Packs-Year (PY) = number of packs smoked per day + number of years of tobacco use

option_d.title: Option D
option_d.description: Packs-Year (PA) = number of packs smoked per day x number of years of intoxication + 1

correct_option.title: Correct Option
correct_option.description: The correct answer should be a mathematical formula
